replication_study.hypothesis: Among lower-caste households (locaste == 1), residing in a low-caste dominated village (locaste_land_v == 1) is associated with higher net agricultural income per acre (net_inc_per_acre) compared to residing in an upper-caste dominated village (locaste_land_v == 0).

data_plan.source_type: Field survey-based dataset harmonized for analysis (derived from UP–Bihar LSMS 1997–1998 and village-level data; see post_registration.json and original_paper.pdf).
data_plan.wave_or_subset: Household-level observations from villages in Uttar Pradesh and Bihar; dataset appears restricted to lower-caste households (locaste == 1).
data_plan.access_details: analysis_data.dta provided in the replication_data folder; for execution, place the file in /app/data as analysis_data.dta.

qualification.explanation: This dataset is a harmonized analysis file consistent with the original study’s setting (UP–Bihar, 1997–1998) and variables. It retains the key constructs needed to test the focal claim (village low-caste dominance indicator, household agricultural income per acre, controls for literacy and land ownership, and state fixed effects).
qualification.similarity_to_original: The original data source is the UP–Bihar LSMS survey and village-level information (post_registration.json: original_study.data.source; original_paper.pdf summary). The provided dataset includes: net_inc_per_acre (agricultural income per acre), a low-caste dominated village indicator (locaste_land_v), household literacy (literate_hh), land_owned, stcode (state), and vill_id (village cluster), matching the original constructs (post_registration.json: method/models/outcomes; original_paper.pdf summary of OLS with controls and FE).
qualification.deviation_from_original: The dataset here appears already restricted to lower-caste households (locaste == 1 according to variable summary), while the original paper analyzes lower-caste subsamples alongside broader samples. Some controls (e.g., district fixed effects and additional environmental/credit/tenancy controls) are not included due to absence in the dataset (post_registration.json mentions these controls; dataset inspection shows stcode but not district identifiers). Thus, the replication focuses on the core OLS specification with literacy, land-owned, and state FE.

data_plan.notes: Variables present: net_inc_per_acre (outcome), locaste_land_v (focal LCV indicator), literate_hh, land_owned, stcode, vill_id. The variable locaste equals 1 for all rows in this dataset (lower-caste restriction). land_owned has 73 missing values; model uses listwise deletion. All IO uses /app/data. Outputs: regression_summary.txt, regression_table.csv, and results_lcv_income.json.

steps: Load data and restrict to non-missing on outcome, focal indicator, controls, and stcode.
Estimate OLS of net_inc_per_acre on locaste_land_v with controls (literate_hh, land_owned) and state fixed effects C(stcode).
Compute heteroskedasticity-robust (HC1) standard errors for inference.
Compute village-clustered standard errors (clustered by vill_id) as a robustness check.
Save regression summary, coefficient table, and focal coefficient JSON to /app/data.
planned_method.models: Linear OLS regression with heteroskedasticity-robust (HC1) SEs; robustness with village-clustered SEs.
planned_method.independent_variables: locaste_land_v (focal). Controls: literate_hh, land_owned, C(stcode) as state fixed effects.
planned_method.control_variables: literate_hh (household literacy), land_owned (land owned), state fixed effects via C(stcode).

planned_estimation_and_test.estimation: Coefficient on locaste_land_v in OLS, interpreted as the association of residing in a low-caste dominated village with net agricultural income per acre among lower-caste households.
planned_estimation_and_test.test: Two-sided t-test H0: beta_locaste_land_v = 0 using HC1 robust SEs; robustness with village-clustered SEs.

planned_method.missing_data_handling: Listwise deletion on variables used in the model.
planned_method.multiple_testing_policy: Single focal outcome; no multiple testing correction.
planned_method.inference_criteria: Primary: positive sign on locaste_land_v; statistical significance at alpha = 0.05 (and noting if alpha = 0.01 is met to compare with original).

files.replication_data/run_replication.py: Entrypoint script. Reads /app/data/analysis_data.dta, runs OLS with HC1 SEs and village-clustered SEs of net_inc_per_acre ~ locaste_land_v + literate_hh + land_owned + C(stcode), and saves outputs to /app/data: regression_summary.txt, regression_table.csv, results_lcv_income.json.

codebase.notes: Ensure /app/data contains analysis_data.dta before running. The script uses pandas.read_stata and statsmodels; all paths hardcode IO to /app/data per run policy.

analysis.instructions: 1) Place analysis_data.dta into ./data so it mounts to /app/data. 2) Run: python replication_data/run_replication.py. 3) Inspect /app/data/regression_summary.txt for full model output, /app/data/regression_table.csv for coefficient table, and /app/data/results_lcv_income.json for the focal coefficient and p-value.
analysis.comparison_metrics: Compare the sign, magnitude, and significance of the coefficient on locaste_land_v to the original (initial_details.txt: ~566.5 with robust SE ~209, significant at 1%). Record N, R-squared, and standard errors. Evaluate whether the effect remains positive and statistically significant with robust/clustered SEs.
